x_symbol.description: Perform a preorder traversal on nested ULs starting at oUL. If there is a nested UL it must be a direct child of the LI (not neccessarily the first). Only supports having one nested UL in each LI. The callback function is called for every LI.

par.name: data
par.note: passed to callbackFn on every call (optional)

x_symbol.return: true if callback fn only returned true; false if callback fn returned false

comment.author: mf
comment.note:
Call-back function syntax: [code] r = fn(p, li, c, d, lvl)
r: return false to cancel, true to continue p: parent UL of li li: LI element c: child UL - the first UL in LI if any d: data - the data object originally passed to xWalkUL lvl: level - indicates the depth of nested ULs[/code]

rev.author: mf
rev.note: Added the 'level' feature and reduced size by 17 bytes. This change does not affect backwards compatibility.
